system.description:
Racial Traits

  • Plains orcs can use any ranged weapon as if it were one size smaller. This only applies to using, not concealing.
  • Plains orcs can not use Fine, Diminutive, or Tiny sized weapons, and take a −2 penalty when using all Small sized weapons.
  • Plains orcs receive the extra feat Combat Martial Arts at 1st level for free.
  • Plains orcs can select Karkarash Proper, Karkarash Technical or  Karkarash Gutter as their native language.

Racial Traits (Active Effect)

  • Plains orcs are Medium sized creatures.
  • Plains orcs gain a +3 Racial Recoil Bonus to recoil when using any weapon that has recoil.
  • Plains orcs have a base Combat Point score of 14.
  • Plains orcs CHP formula is CON Score 3.

Physical Description

A healthy plains orc typically stands between 5¾-6½’, and weighs between 160-270 lbs. The males are significantly larger than the females, usually towering a good foot above them. Male and female orcs begin to grow out their inferior canines as they reach adulthood, that sit in front of the lower lip once fully grown. These canines are considered a badge of adulthood, and are kept clean and sharp. Orc skin tone ranges in the grays, browns, and greens, and their hair ranges from dark brown to black, usually in a coarse, curly texture. The average orc lifespan is 130 years, reaching physical adulthood between the ages of 16-20.

Language

The native language of a plains orc depends on their background.

Names

Plains orcs generally have two sets of names. The first name being their legal, recorded name, that usually follows the same naming conventions that humans use, and a second, given name at a teeth cutting ceremony. The newly adult orc is given a title, that includes their first name, with an adjective describing them. As they go throughout life, they will be granted more titles by more experienced, higher titled orcs.
